titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I bade mine host farewell, and returned to Durham. The station–master at Manchester came to me as I sate in the train awaiting its start, and said that he had been in the Cathedral on Sunday afternoon, & that the Railwaymen had been much impressed by the sermon. At Durham I was joined by Gee, a nephew of the Principal, whom I had invited to the Deanery. I attended the trial of three candidates for the lay–clerkship vacated by Akeroyd's resignation. We elected Gregory from King's, Cambridge.
